intro: Craterostigma stuhlmannii, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, fleshy, alternate leaves and produces clusters of tiny, yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, exhibiting succulence to store water. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is known for its ability to survive in harsh, rocky soils. Craterostigma stuhlmannii is also noted for its potential use in phytoremediation due to its tolerance of heavy metals.
